page.title: 02MAN AND NATURE WARDLOW
page.content: {Ecology Cressbrook Wardlow {WARDLOW HAY COP}is unimproved grassland,one of the nearby limestone crags is prohibited to climbers thus making the flora available to botanists. {LONGSTONE MOOR}is a limestone plateau supporting primary acidic heathland vegetation which provides cover for grouse and other heathland fauna and nesting birds.Unused lead rakes criss-cross the moor.On the eastern side a man made lagoon,or settling pond,is used for fluorspar waste attracting wading birds.Of the 180 dew ponds,(walled basins with puddled clay bases)100 contain water where crested newts,a protected species,breed. {MILLERS DALE}at the eastern end a disused railway line with undisturbed limestone chippings provides a natural habitat for orchids.
